case_vignette:
A 32-year-old male with past medical history of poorly controlled HIV presents to clinic with dark spots on the skin and in the mouth. He cannot recall when they first started. He denies any drug or alcohol use. He is not currently taking his antiretroviral therapy. Examination reveals multiple ovoid violaceous ruddy, brown ovoid macules on the trunk, legs, oral palate and plantar feet. A punch biopsy is performed and stains for HHV-8 is positive.   The patient is diagnosed with Kaposi's sarcoma.
Rewritten text:
A 32-year-old patient with a past medical history of poorly controlled HIV presents to clinic with dark spots on the skin and in the mouth. The patient cannot recall when they first started. The patient denies any drug or alcohol use. The patient is not currently taking their antiretroviral therapy. Examination reveals multiple ovoid violaceous ruddy, brown ovoid macules on the trunk, legs, oral palate and plantar feet. A punch biopsy is performed and stains for HHV-8 is positive.   The patient is diagnosed with Kaposi's sarcoma.

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have dark spots on my skin and in my mouth.
How long have you had these dark spots?
I cannot recall when they first started.
Do these spots cause any pain or itching?
There is no mention of pain or itching in the description of my symptoms.
Have you noticed any changes in the size or color of these spots over time?
I don't have any information on changes in the size or color of the spots over time.
Do you have a personal or family history of skin conditions or other related illnesses?
There is no mention of a personal or family history of skin conditions or other related illnesses in my medical history provided.
Are you currently taking any medications or have you recently taken any?
I am not currently taking my antiretroviral therapy.
Final Diagnosis: HIV-associated oral and cutaneous hyperpigmentation.
